cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northwest across the southern Gulf of Mexico toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Vermilion Bay–Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for the U.S. Gulf Coast at this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for the U.S. Gulf Coast at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward across all of Louisiana to the Mississippi/Alabama border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds (39–57 mph) are increasingly likely, with a low–moderate chance (≈26%) of sustained 50-kt (58-mph) winds; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening storm surge of 4–7 ft possible along southeast and south-central Louisiana coast, including lower Mississippi River terminals.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause flash-flooding and operational disruption along the Mississippi River corridor.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands; dangerous seas and river swell affecting vessel traffic management.
